page.title: 10ECOLOGY, HEMEL HEMPSTEAD
page.content: The 12 square kms feature the{River {Gade,}which cuts a wide shallow valley through{Chilterns Chalk}based hill land. Wild hedgerow flowers like toadflax and scabious and mixed grasses reflect well-drained chalk based land. {River Gade}has been dammed to create water gardens planted with trees, and islands for water fowl.{Gadebridge {Park}is less formalised, with minnows, stickleback and yellow iris in the river. In the{Adeyfield}area there is a 4 to 5 hundred year old track hedge. It has hedgerow trees like hawthorn, ash, oak, hazel, elder and beech. The{NW}of the area is undulating farmland, free of wild plants except in hedgerows.{Howe Grove}is deciduous woodland, overused by dog walkers and children. Beech trees are common.
